description: A 30 day curfew decreed in the Republic of Congo. An announcement made by the president Denis Sassou Nguesso, 24 hours after the confirmation of 15 new coronavirus cases. The night time curfew is scheduled from 8 p.m. to 5 a.m. local time, while the restrictions concern the entire population “except those working to provide essential goods and services,” according to the head of state.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The national government of the Republic of the Congo declared a "state of health emergency" on March 28th 2020
Congo: State of health emergency extended until July 30.
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: The Republic of the Congo is canceling all flights to high-risk COVID-19 countries as of March 19th. On March 19th, the Prime Minister Clement Mouamba also declared that "The presentation of a negative COVID-19 test result, carried out by an approved institution, now accompanies any visa application for entry into the territory of the Republic of the Congo."
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The presentation of a negative COVID-19 test result, carried out by an approved institution, now accompanies any visa application for entry into the territory of the Republic of the Congo.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction

description: The national government of the Republic of the Congo is closing as of March 21st "all borders including land, river, sea, and air" effective immediately.

On August 11, the government of the Republic of Congo announced that on August 24 the border closure policy will be adjusted to allow international flights, though land and sea travel will remain closed.
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban

description: On March 26, the prime minister of the Republic of the Congo announced that all treatment due to a positive covid test and contact tracing quarantine shall be paid by the government.
type_sub_cat: Health Insurance

description: On June 10, the minister of health of the Republic of the Congo received digital solutions for usage by the government, one of which is Educovid, containing assistance for those sick with Covid or in need of using medical services such as with pregnancy.
type_sub_cat: Other Health Materials

description: On July 7, the general health inspectorate of the Republic of the Congo determined to have private health organizations to also take in Covid patients, being available nationally to care for such patients.
type_sub_cat: Hospitals

description: On March 31, the civil security director of the Republic of the Congo announced that the minister of the interior fixed the conditions on daily markets. The market will be closed and disinfected if a COVID-19 is found from it.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for commercial areas

description: On March 31, the minister of the interior fixed the conditions on daily markets, as announced by the Civil Security Director on March 31. Sunday and Wednesday are reserved for disinfection, with the markets closed on those days.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for commercial areas

description: On March 31, the minister of the interior fixed the conditions on daily markets, as announced by the Civil Security Director on March 31. Sunday and Wednesday are reserved for disinfection, with the markets closed on those days.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for commercial areas

description: On July 3, upon receiving donations from the UNFPA, the minister of youth and civic education organized a training including using and gifting to the youth equipment for respecting the protections. It included 28 youth organizations and the event was in partnership with the UN, lasting from July 7 to July 8.
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On July 28, the minister of the interior of the Republic of the Congo released a new set of regulations on July 28 which apply starting from July 28, requiring mask wearing for all sellers and clients in daily markets
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for commercial areas

description: On August 26, the head of government of the Republic of the Congo assisted in a special delivery of sanitary equipment to several villages containing handicapped individuals in the district of Mayeye to help the native population and vulnerable population.
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: On March 28, the president of the Republic of the Congo declared that starting March 31 all traffic by citizens except those deemed essential will be banned.
On March 30, the president of the Republic of the Congo declared a lockdown from March 31 to the end of April.
It was announced on January 26 by the director of epidemiology and the fight against illness that the minister of health created a crisis unit that meets every day regarding the covid outbreak.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description:
The prime minister of the Republic of the Congo announced on March 16th that the government established "a fund to contain the spread of COVID-19 and to intensify controls at checkpoints of entry by mobilizing additional health and security teams at land borders" 
The government has set forth a budget of 2 million euros towards this fund
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On March 18, president of the Republic of Congo announced a decree was passed establishing a task force tasked with informing high authorities about the consequences of COVID-19 on the national economy and society named Task Force on the Economic and Social Impact of COVID-19.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On March 27, the National Coordination announced the Management of the Covid-19 Coronavirus Pandemic was created under the authority of the president of the Republic of the Congo.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On March 27, the Prime Minister of the Republic of the Congo announced in a decree created the National Committee on the response to the coronavirus pandemic (COVID-19).
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On March 27, the president of the Republic of the Congo decreed the creation of a national coordination of management of the coronavirus pandemic including in its tasks communication with the public through public reports to inform the population about the social, economic, health, and security situation of the country regarding the pandemic at unspecified intervals.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On April 3, 30 scientists were designated by ministers of the Republic of the Congo, to make a college of experts, that are to recommend biological management, and other essential solutions to the pandemic.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: The Republic of Congo announced a 21 billion CFA budget to help combat the pandemic on March 27th.
type_text: The government has put to get there a fund for fighting the pandemic with no specific areas of funding or mobilization being targetted

description: On March 28, the president of the Republic of the Congo announced the creation, starting March 31, of a national solidarity fund for supporting businesses, compensation for lost revenue, and aid for vulnerable persons, stating that it must mobilize at least 100 billion francs CFA during April 2020.
type_text: A fund was created to gather funds for supporting businesses, compensating for the revenue lost in the lockdown, and aiding vulnerable people.

description: The Republic of the Congo issued that during the confinement period, 4 billion FCFA from the government will go towards paying for water and electricity for households on April 10th 2020.
type_text: Paid Water and Heating by the National government during the confinement period
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 27, the minister of health of the Republic of the Congo determined to spread public awareness information in the capital, Brazzaville, speakers, microphones, megaphones,  posters, placards, chasubles and T-shirts.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On March 27, the head of the health promotion department of the Republic of the Congo stated that each department organises its own public awareness activities, including information at bus stops and handwashing demonstrations.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 8, the Communication Commision made available to the communication commisions of the departments of Pointe-Noire and Brazzaville 24 vehicles that are decorated with covid information and have loudspeakers for spreading public awareness.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 8, the Communication Commision made available to the communication commisions of the departments of Pointe-Noire and Brazzaville 24 vehicles that will transport health promotion facilitators and a communication support distribution agent to spread awareness from 7:00 to 19:00 in neighborhoods, bus stops, daily markets, and other public spaces.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 16, the departmental management committee of the coronavirus pandemic of the department of Plateaux in the Republic of the Congo announced that a working tour to assist with the departmental public awareness campaign until April 19 that was instructed by the head of the health promotion department of the Republic of the Congo.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 16, the Prime Minister of the Republic of the Congo announced from May 18, the public awareness campaigns in frontier localities will be intensified.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 20, several ministers of the Republic of the Congo and executive of the Coronavirus Pandemic Response Committee determined on several measures to be applied when schools reopen on June 1. It was determined that public awareness must be done for the students and parents regarding the coronavirus.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 10, the minister of health of the Republic of the Congo received digital solutions for usage by the government, one of which is Chatbot, allowing mass public awareness through telephone message.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On the 17th of June, the department of health and population at Brazzaville started a public awareness campaign in Brazzaville through input awareness teams popularizing preventative practices such as mask wearing, hand washing, and social distancing.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On July 3, upon receiving support from the UNFPA, the minister of youth and civic education organized a training for public awareness against covid for 28 youth organizations in partnership with the UN from July 7 to July 8.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Brazzaville announced on Wednesday March 4 that "any passenger from countries at risk will be quarantined upon arrival in the Republic of Congo" to fight against the coronavirus, citing five countries: France, Italy, China , South Korea and Iran.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Brazzaville announced on Wednesday March 4 that "any passenger from countries at risk will be quarantined upon arrival in the Republic of Congo" to fight against the coronavirus, citing five countries: France, Italy, China , South Korea and Iran.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 9, the minister of health of the Republic of the Congo precised that the March 4th quarantine policy will have those quarantined at home called every 2 days to get updates on their state of health and ensure the quarantine rules are being followed starting March 10.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On March 9, the minister of health of the Republic of the Congo precised that the March 4th quarantine policy will have those quarantined at home called every 2 days to get updates on their state of health and ensure the quarantine rules are being followed starting March 10.
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine

description: The Republic of Congo's government declared to the public to "be vigilant and all travelers from high-risk countries to quarantine themselves for 14 days" after confirming the country's first case March 14th.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On June 23, The Prefect of Pointe-Noire declared all of the privately run sites of quarantine to be closed or integrate into the state starting from June 25.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: On June 23, The Prefect of Pointe-Noire declared all of the privately run sites of quarantine to be closed or integrate into the state starting from June 25.
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine

description: On March 24, the mayor of Brazzaville enacted starting March 25 policies for Brazzaville regarding Covid-19. It was established that buses must be limited in number of passengers to allow social distancing, with 30 maximum in bus bus STPU, 10 in a Hiace, 20 in a Coaster, and 4 in a Picnic. Disciplinary sanctions will be taken against rule breakers.
type_sub_cat: Transportation (land; water and air)
institution_status: This type of business  ("Transportation (land; water and air)") is allowed to open with conditions

description: On March 24, the mayor of Brazzaville enacted starting March 25 policies for Brazzaville regarding Covid-19. It was established that masks and gloves are obligatory for chauffeurs, controllers, and riders of common transport. Disciplinary sanctions will be taken against rule breakers.
type_sub_cat: Transportation (land; water and air)
institution_status: This type of business  ("Transportation (land; water and air)") is allowed to open with conditions

description: On March 31, the civil security director of the Republic of the Congo announced that the minister of the interior fixed the conditions on daily markets. The daily markets are open only 6:00-16:00 during the approved days.
type_sub_cat: Commercial Businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: On March 9, the minister of health of the Republic of the Congo precised that the March 4th quarantine policy will have those quarantined at home required to wear a mask when in front of someone else, keep distance, and remain in the house starting March 10.
type_sub_cat: Other Mask Wearing Policy

description: On March 24, the mayor of Brazzaville enacted starting March 25 policies for Brazzaville regarding Covid-19. It was established that 1 meter must be kept obligatorily after boarding buses and when at bus stops. Disciplinary sanctions will be taken against rule breakers.
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
